theorem tprod_tprod (l : List δ) (μ : ∀ i, Measure (π i)) [∀ i, SigmaFinite (μ i)] (s : ∀ i, Set (π i)) :
    measure.tprod l μ (Set.tprod l s) = (l.map fun i => (μ i) (s i)).prod :=
  by
  induction' l with i l ih; · simp
  rw [tprod_cons, Set.tprod, prod_prod, map_cons, prod_cons, ih]
#align tprod_tprod tprod_tprod

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
theorem pi_pi_aux [∀ i, SigmaFinite (μ i)] (s : ∀ i, Set (α i)) (hs : ∀ i, MeasurableSet (s i)) :
    measure.pi μ (pi univ s) =
      finset.prod_univ "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ"
        (μ i (s i)) :=

    apply outer_measure.pi_pi_le
  · haveI : Encodable ι := Fintype.toEncodable ι
    rw [← pi'_pi μ s]
    simp_rw [← pi'_pi μ s, measure.pi, to_measure_apply _ _ (MeasurableSet.pi countable_univ fun i _ => hs i), ←
      to_outer_measure_apply]

theorem pi_of_empty {α : Type _} [IsEmpty α] {β : α → Type _} {m : ∀ a, MeasurableSpace (β a)}
    (μ : ∀ a : α, Measure (β a)) (x : ∀ a, β a := isEmptyElim) : measure.pi μ = dirac x :=
  by
  haveI : ∀ a, sigma_finite (μ a) := isEmptyElim
  refine' pi_eq fun s hs => _
  rw [Fintype.prod_empty, dirac_apply_of_mem]
  exact isEmptyElim
#align pi_of_empty pi_of_empty

theorem pi_hyperplane (i : ι) [NoAtoms (μ i)] (x : α i) : measure.pi μ { f : ∀ i, α i | f i = x } = 0 :=
  show measure.pi μ («expr ⁻¹' » (eval i) {x}) = 0 from pi_eval_preimage_null _ (measure_singleton x)
#align pi_hyperplane pi_hyperplane
pi_has_no_atoms:
/-- If one of the measures `μ i` has no atoms, them `measure.pi µ`
has no atoms. The instance below assumes that all `μ i` have no atoms. -/
theorem pi_has_no_atoms (i : ι) [NoAtoms (μ i)] : NoAtoms (measure.pi μ) :=
  ⟨fun x => flip measure_mono_null (pi_hyperplane μ i (x i)) (singleton_subset_iff.2 rfl)⟩
#align pi_has_no_atoms pi_has_no_atoms
pi_eval_preimage_null:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⁻¹' » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⁻¹' » -/
theorem pi_eval_preimage_null {i : ι} {s : Set (α i)} (hs : μ i s = 0) : measure.pi μ («expr ⁻¹' » (eval i) s) = 0 :=
  by
  -- WLOG, `s` is measurable
  rcases exists_measurable_superset_of_null hs with ⟨t, hst, htm, hμt⟩
  suffices : measure.pi μ («expr ⁻¹' » (eval i) t) = 0
  exact measure_mono_null (preimage_mono hst) this
  clear! s
  -- Now rewrite it as `set.pi`, and apply `pi_pi`
  rw [← univ_pi_update_univ, pi_pi]
  apply Finset.prod_eq_zero (Finset.mem_univ i)
  simp [hμt]
#align pi_eval_preimage_null pi_eval_preimage_null
pi_eq_generateFrom:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
#print pi_eq_generateFrom /-
-- TODO (kmill) If this let comes before the refine, while the noncomputability checker
-- correctly sees this definition is computable, the Lean VM fails to see the binding is
-- computationally irrelevant. The `noncomputable theory` doesn't help because all it does
-- is insert `noncomputable` for you when necessary.
/-- A measure on a finite product space equals the product measure if they are equal on rectangles
  with as sides sets that generate the corresponding σ-algebras. -/
theorem pi_eq_generateFrom {C : ∀ i, Set (Set (α i))} (hC : ∀ i, generateFrom (C i) = by apply_assumption)
    (h2C : ∀ i, IsPiSystem (C i)) (h3C : ∀ i, (μ i).finite_spanning_sets_in (C i)) {μν : Measure (∀ i, α i)}
    (h₁ :
      ∀ s : ∀ i, Set (α i),
        (∀ i, s i ∈ C i) →
          μν (pi univ s) =
            finset.prod_univ "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ"
              (μ i (s i))) :
    measure.pi μ = μν :=
  by
  have h4C : ∀ (i) (s : Set (α i)), s ∈ C i → MeasurableSet s :=
    by
    intro i s hs
    rw [← hC]
    exact measurable_set_generate_from hs
  refine'
    (finite_spanning_sets_in.pi h3C).ext (generate_from_eq_pi hC fun i => (h3C i).is_countably_spanning).symm
      (is_pi_system.pi h2C) _
  rintro _ ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
  rw [mem_univ_pi] at hs
  haveI := fun i => (h3C i).sigma_finite
  simp_rw [h₁ s hs, pi_pi_aux μ s fun i => h4C i _ (hs i)]
#align pi_eq_generate_from pi_eq_generateFrom
-/
pi_eq:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ -/
/-- A measure on a finite product space equals the product measure if they are equal on
  rectangles. -/
theorem pi_eq {μ' : Measure (∀ i, α i)}
    (h :
      ∀ s : ∀ i, Set (α i),
        (∀ i, MeasurableSet (s i)) →
          μ' (pi univ s) =
            finset.prod_univ "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `finset.prod_univ"
              (μ i (s i))) :
    measure.pi μ = μ' :=
  pi_eq_generate_from (fun i => generateFrom_measurableSet) (fun i => isPiSystem_measurableSet)
    (fun i => (μ i).to_finite_spanning_sets_in) h
#align pi_eq pi_eq

pi_caratheodory:
theorem pi_caratheodory : MeasurableSpace.pi ≤ (outer_measure.pi fun i => (μ i).to_outer_measure).caratheodory :=
  by
  refine' supᵢ_le _
  intro i s hs
  rw [MeasurableSpace.comap] at hs
  rcases hs with ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
  apply bounded_by_caratheodory
  intro t
  simp_rw [pi_premeasure]
  refine' Finset.prod_add_prod_le' (Finset.mem_univ i) _ _ _
  · simp [image_inter_preimage, image_diff_preimage, measure_inter_add_diff _ hs, le_refl]
  · rintro j - hj
    apply mono'
    apply image_subset
    apply inter_subset_left
  · rintro j - hj
    apply mono'
    apply image_subset
    apply diff_subset
#align pi_caratheodory pi_caratheodory

theorem le_pi {m : ∀ i, OuterMeasure (α i)} {n : OuterMeasure (∀ i, α i)} :
    n ≤ outer_measure.pi m ↔
      ∀ s : ∀ i, Set (α i),
        (pi univ s).nonempty →

    refine' le_trans (n.mono <| subset_pi_eval_image univ s) (h _ _)
    simp [univ_pi_nonempty_iff, hs]

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr '' » -/
/-- The product of generated σ-algebras is the one generated by boxes, if both generating sets
  are countably spanning. -/
theorem generate_from_pi_eq {C : ∀ i, Set (Set (α i))} (hC : ∀ i, IsCountablySpanning (C i)) :
    (@MeasurableSpace.pi _ _ fun i => generateFrom (C i)) = generateFrom («expr '' » (pi univ) (pi univ C)) :=
  by
  cases nonempty_encodable ι
  apply le_antisymm
  · refine' supᵢ_le _
    intro i
    rw [comap_generate_from]
    apply generate_from_le
    rintro _ ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
    dsimp
    choose t h1t h2t using hC
    simp_rw [eval_preimage, ← h2t]
    rw [← @Union_const _ ℕ _ s]
    have :
      pi univ
          (update (fun i' : ι => Union (t i')) i
            («expr⋃ , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , »" s)) =
        pi univ fun k =>
          «expr⋃ , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⋃ , »"
            (@update ι (fun i' => Set (α i')) _ (fun i' => t i' j) i s k) :=
      by
      ext
      simp_rw [mem_univ_pi]
      apply forall_congr'
      intro i'
      by_cases i' = i
      · subst h
        simp
      · rw [← ne.def] at h
        simp [h]
    rw [this, ← Union_univ_pi]
    apply MeasurableSet.unionᵢ
    intro n
    apply measurable_set_generate_from
    apply mem_image_of_mem
    intro j _
    dsimp only
    by_cases h : j = i
    subst h
    rwa [update_same]
    rw [update_noteq h]
    apply h1t
  · apply generate_from_le
    rintro _ ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
    rw [univ_pi_eq_Inter]
    apply MeasurableSet.interᵢ
    intro i
    apply measurable_pi_apply
    exact measurable_set_generate_from (hs i (mem_univ i))
#align generate_from_pi_eq generate_from_pi_eq

/-- The product σ-algebra is generated from boxes, i.e. `s ×ˢ t` for sets `s : set α` and
  `t : set β`. -/
theorem generate_from_pi [∀ i, MeasurableSpace (α i)] :
    generateFrom («expr '' » (pi univ) (pi univ fun i => { s : Set (α i) | MeasurableSet s })) = MeasurableSpace.pi :=
  generate_from_eq_pi (fun i => generateFrom_measurableSet) fun i => isCountablySpanning_measurableSet

/-- If `C` and `D` generate the σ-algebras on `α` resp. `β`, then rectangles formed by `C` and `D`

    generateFrom («expr '' » (pi univ) (pi univ C)) = MeasurableSpace.pi := by rw [← funext hC, generate_from_pi_eq h2C]
#align generate_from_eq_pi generate_from_eq_pi
